Show:

Sprite Class

Uses
  • EventEmitter
Extends PIXI.Sprite(http://www.goodboydigital.com/pixijs/docs/classes/Sprite.html)
Defined in: src\display\Sprite.js:10

The base Sprite class. This class is the base for all images on the screen. This class extends PIXI's Sprite.

Constructor

Sprite

(
  • textures
  • [speed]
  • [start]
)

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:10

Parameters:

  • textures Texture | Array | Object

    The texture for the sprite to display, an array of texture to animation through, or an animation object. The later looks like: { animationName: { frames: [frame1, frame2], speed: 0.5, loop: false } } where each frame is a Texture object

  • [speed] Number optional

    The speed of the animations (can be overriden on a specific animations)

  • [start] String optional

    The animation to start with, defaults to the first found key otherwise

Example:

 var spr = new gf.Sprite(texture);

  • Methods
  • Properties
  • Events

(
  • name
  • frames
  • [speed]
  • [loop]
)
Sprite chainable

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:232

Adds a new animation to this animated sprite

Parameters:

  • name String

    The string name of the animation

  • frames Array

    The array of texture frames

  • [speed] Number optional

    The animation speed

  • [loop] Boolean optional

    Loop the animation or not

Returns:

Sprite:

Returns itself.

goto

(
  • frame
  • [name]
)
Sprite chainable

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:257

Goes to a frame and starts playing the animation from there. You can optionally pass the name of a new aniamtion to start playing.

Parameters:

  • frame Number

    The index of the frame to start on

  • [name] String optional

    The string name of the animation to go to

Returns:

Sprite:

Returns itself.

Properties

animations

Object

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:99

The registerd animations for this AnimatedSprite

currentAnimation

String

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:108

The currently playing animation

currentFrame

Number

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:117

The current frame being shown

lifetime

Number private

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:68

The lifetime of the sprite. Once it reaches 0 (after being set) the sprite's visible property is set to false, so that it will no longer be rendered. NOT YET IMPLEMENTED

Default: Infinity

loop

Boolean

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:89

Whether or not to loop the animations. This can be overriden on a per-animation level

Default: false

name

String

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:59

The name of the sprite

Default: ''

playing

Boolean

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:126

Whether or not the animation is currently playing

speed

Number

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:80

The animation speed for this sprite

Default: 1

Events

click

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:380

A callback that is used when the users clicks on the sprite with their mouse

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

complete

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:148

Fired when the running animation completes

Event Payload:

  • animation String

    The animation that has completed

frame

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:140

Fired when a new frame of the running animation is shown

Event Payload:

  • animation String

    The animation name that is playing

  • frameId Number

    The frame that is being shown

mousedown

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:387

A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse down over the sprite

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:424

A callback that is used when the user moves the mouse while over the sprite

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:417

A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the sprite

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:410

A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the sprite

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

mouseup

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:394

A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the sprite for this callback to be fired the mouse must have been pressed down over the sprite

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

mouseupoutside

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:402

A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the sprite but is no longer over the sprite for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the sprite

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

tap

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:435

A callback that is used when the users taps on the sprite with their finger basically a touch version of click

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

touchend

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:450

A callback that is used when the user releases a touch over the sprite

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

touchendoutside

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:457

Event Payload:

  • interactionData InteractionData

Defined in src\display\Sprite.js:443
